content.question: Two objects, X and Y, experience external net torques that vary over a period of <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> seconds. Object X has a moment of inertia <math alttext="I sub 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, and Object Y has a moment of inertia <math alttext="2 I sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. The average value of the magnitude of the external net torque exerted on Object X from time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> to <math alttext="t equals 5 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math> is <math alttext="tau sub X" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mi>X</mi></msub></math>. Similarly, the average value for Object Y is <math alttext="tau sub Y" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mi>Y</mi></msub></math>. The magnitudes of the angular momenta <math alttext="L" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math> of Objects X and Y versus <math alttext=" t" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> are shown in the graph. Which of the following expressions correctly relates <math alttext="tau sub Y" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mi>Y</mi></msub></math> to <math alttext="tau sub X" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mi>X</mi></msub></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="tau sub Y equals, 4 tau sub X" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mi>Y</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>τ</mi><mi>X</mi></msub></math>
<math alttext="tau sub Y equals, 2 tau sub X" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mi>Y</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>τ</mi><mi>X</mi></msub></math>
<math alttext="2 tau sub Y equals, tau sub X" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>τ</mi><mi>Y</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mi>X</mi></msub></math>
<math alttext="4 tau sub Y equals, tau sub X" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>τ</mi><mi>Y</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mi>X</mi></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="tau sub Y equals, 2 tau sub X" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mi>Y</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>τ</mi><mi>X</mi></msub></math>

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
